I quickly became addicted to this show and have watched every episode on this site. The 22 minute format is great because the true stories are effectively told but not drawn out too long with unnecessary details. I feel this entire series should be required study for all citizens going into ANY career related to law, law enforcement, social work, sociology, psychology, political science, emergency services, security and detective work, etc. It has changed my view of the world and reduced whatever levels of rose-coloring are still in my glasses. People who have a too-liberal political slant will, I believe, especially benefit from watching this series even though it will "push their buttons" and be difficult at times.

This series delves into older (read here: solved) cases and how science (forensics) helped the police solve those cases and bring the guilty party to justice. The solving methods and crimes are varied, they do tend towards the more violent crimes. Having said that I have seen at least one case that involved computers and how they solved the case using digital forensics. Yes, they do make sure to include the human side of things, and they do a good job of not giving away the answer to whodunnit too early, but it is still a reality-based crime show.

This is a terrific series.  Extremely informative.  Bad guys will use it to try to avoid being detected.  But, it seems, you always leave something behind that points to you as the culprit of a crime and you can get caught far more quickly than you realize, no matter how well you cover your tracks.  Forensic evidence and modern technology and creative minds will nab you every time.  Just not too long ago, juries did not understand forensic science.  The case of OJ Simpson was a case where people became reluctant to believe in it completely.  Now, juries look forward to 'following' the evidence.  Many of these cases happened before the OJ trial, yet, forensic  science was used, o(f course, since that is the title of the series).  Forensic science that eventually  proved guilt with the bad guy getting his comeuppance.  But it takes skill when presenting this type of evidence.  And it takes greater skill in finding it.  It is always there, it just requires patience, a lot of thought and the latest technology to find it.  I love the way each episode was presented.  Never dumbing it down for the audience.  Taking us each step of the way to find out what happened and why.  This is one of the better--probably the best--crime evidence shows ever made.  To the people who put it together (that definitely took work and time, too), thank you, all of you for bringing us true stories of the amazing strides made in forensic science that is not theory, but proven fact!  Well done!

Like the rest of the series, these are interesting - but not completely accurate. You'll find contradictions in the narrative, errors in placement of photos, and gaping holes in the stories. Just follow up on some episodes' cases and you'll find that a great deal has.been omitted or altered in these stories. Still a good enough series, especially from the historical perspective regarding first time specific types of forensic evidence was presented in a case.

Forensic Files started as a binge watch program that I only watched when I was travelling and in the hotel room.
There would be marathon sessions on whatever channel it was on, and I'd stay up for hours into the early morning watching them back to back.
On a recent trip, I started googling about the program and eventually discovered that it was also available on prime (not all the full seasons but the "best of" of the seasons).

I was in heaven...the show is totally addicting. It's not a big deal for me that there are a few episodes missing, because quite frankly, I haven't even noticed - there's a HUGE collection here. All of them are worthy of binge watching, but I have been skipping around a bit. After reading some of the previews, there are some that sound more interesting than others, but they all impress.

The VO is tremendous and emotional when it needs to be. Sometimes I giggle when I shouldn't, but such is the show.

The program takes us through a crime and the forensic science that figures it all out. In many cases you will find that the people in these cases have gone on to do great things (trust me, google them). It's a fascinating look into the science behind the cases.

Forensic Files is my favorite show on television. I love the soothing voice of Peter Thomas as he narrates the puzzle of murder, crime, deception and mystery. My favorite episode in Season 10 of Forensic Files is Episode 12--Garden of Evil--When a popular disc jockey was found murdered in a community garden, police swung into action. A sniffer dog and a blood spatter expert led police to the killer. It's interesting to see how the smallest piece of evidence can lead straight to the door of the killer.

Forensic Files continues to be my "go to" series when I want to watch a few short TV programs.  I am amazed with the progress of forensic science to catch criminals and Forensic Files really keeps up with technology.  It is also interesting to compare the forensic evidence of a few years ago to what investigators are able to accomplish today.  Some may say that FF is just informing criminals how to be smarter and get away with their crimes.  Rather, my take is that FF is always using forensics to keep one or two steps ahead of the incredible number of dumb criminals.

Like HBO's Autopsy, Forensic Files is one of the more serious and enticing documentary crime series ever to air on television. The series takes an unflinching look (using re-enactments, as well as authentic graphic footage and still photography), at some of the most horrific real-life crimes, both inside and outside the U.S., and allows you to view each case through the eyes of the forensic pathologists, artists, and investigators. Their amazing skill in uncovering vital evidence enables them to give the dead a "voice" which helps law-enforcement to track down cold-blooded killers in the never ending hope of bringing them to justice.
The best documentary film. Scientific analysis in the real-life drama are very remarkable... everyone should watch this film.
Great show.  More please.

It's both good and bad. The crimes are horrible, but you get the satisfaction of seeing these particular ones brought to justice through good forensics. Science is good when done right, but they never get into the fact that forensics can be fouled up too. It shows how the smallest thing can be the key to solving a crime. Remember this is only good if the forensic scientists only use pure scientific  means and don't skew the data. The program never mentions bad forensics.

Great show! Within a half hour show I've gone from weeping to shouting at the screen in joy. It's great when the investigators get the right person, and it's very intense to watch the victim's families share their insight. I love this show!

BTW:
Interstate 97 or I 97 is in Maryland
US Route 97 runs through part of California, Oregon and Washington.
In the first episode of season 9 they keep incorrectly referring to I 97 or Interstate 97, when they should really say ROUTE 97! (Although the highway does run in 3 states and is therefore technically "interstate"... hmm...)

Best True Crime Show available! Walks you through all the incredible forensics wich includes every scientific specialst who can help to solve & prove a crime. All this is done while at the same time showing the utmost respect for the victim & his/her family. F

This is one forensic show I actually enjoyed. It was short and to the point - no endless hour of rehashing the same info over and over. The one thing I found irksome was the female narrators voice. Yikes! A major irritant but fortunately she only spoke for a few moments at the beginning and end.
great show
These are true life crime stories that are fascinating and you really can't guess who the criminal is until all the forensic evidence has been carefully evaluated!
My most best show to watch
we love these series! When we see a new one we always go straight to it! Keep them coming please!
Always intriguing !
this is a GREAT program series. I just wish they were one hour shows. Most are 22 minutes, and that goes quick. If you are a CSI crime show buff this is one of the best shows.
Love it
Forensic Files is ALWAYS good, and I've been watching it for years on cable television.
Love this show
I like this show, as its is short enough that it gets to the point and lot filled with a lot of filler.
Great, well worth the time
Always intriguing, short episodes that you can watch on the fly.
I love this show! It is always very interesting.
just the best show ever !!!!
It would be great if the episodes would play continuously instead of having to start each one. But, what can I say. It's Forensic Files. The shows are great.

A great infomitive show, With A great Narrator. Thank GOD for such Dedicated Men & Women  who  persevere  Until The person is convicted. It is A Time Consuming  task. I really ,,really enjoy watching it.
These are 21 minute shows, they are very intriguing and hold your attention.  Some of the ways they catch killers through forensics is pretty amazing.

This is my favorite show of this typebar none. The episodes are short--only about 22 minutes or so--but very interesting. I'd love it if Amazon would make more available. Many seasons only have 6 episodes. One season has 20+ episodes! Love it!
So far we love all the seasons.  Keep  them coming!  Makes a great movie night and keeps you thinking about how crazy people are..
I would highly recommend this for anyone who likes murder mysteries.  Great way to unwind before bed and with some red wine!
Some of the stories are a kind of old, but if you don't know the crime story, still enjoyable if you like seeing the bad guys (gals) get caught.

I love actual cases of how science forensics has changed so much and helps so much to be PROVEN.  Eye witness accounts differ.  People have their own agenda and fears.  But when it is science and can't be faked it is amazing.  I only wish we could do this faster and cheaper so some people don't sit in prison for months and years before it can be proven they were innocent.  Particularly when they have already exhausted funds for attorneys and it costs upwards of $5000 for some DNA testing and it won't be done free.

These stories are especially gruesome--child murders/rapes, teenage killers, etc. I like that the information isn't repeated over and over again like on Dateline or 48 Hours Mystery; the producers seem to believe the audience has reasoning skills. Really good for the genre but some very disturbing episodes.
Worth watching n learn few lessons in life. It's one of reality shows I like starting from series 1 up to 11.

I've been watching Forensic Files on Cable TV for many years...long before Amazon Fire was even thought of, so I'm not really sure why this even requires a review.

But with that having been said, it's nice to be able to watch this show without having to deal with 10 - 18 commercials every 6 - 7 minutes while watching this, and every other show.

Watching Forensic Files is about the latest in forensics, and is likely to convince anyone not to go out and commit a crime!

When I'm a little sad or depressed, I put on this TV show because it distracts me and also makes me count my blessings that I am alive.  I usually watch it while I'm falling asleep, because it's a good balance of interesting/boring - interesting enough to make me try to halfheartedly watch it, but boring enough that when I start to fall asleep I'm okay with the missing the rest of the episode.
I LOVE SHOWS THAT SHOW HOW TO FIND THE BAD GUY OR BAD GIRLS I CAN WATCH IT ALL DAY
Really like Peter Thomas for The Narrator. He talks so Plain. Programs like that helps to Teach U multiple things.
Still viewing, But so far very Englightening., Interesting , thought Provoking , A teacher of how to B more Watchful , Careful.

The show gives a look into how the police use forensics to solve cases....impressions of shoes or tire tracks, DNA from a piece of gum or a cup...fascinating. Makes you wonder how any murder goes unsolved.
Every episode has new information which is interesting and fun to learn.  Although the series is sometimes graphic this is kept is a minimum.  wish they had all the seasons with all the episodes.
so awesome and very entertaining, keeps a person off the edge off their seat! would recommend anyone to watch these episodes
All I can say is I wish there were more seasons to watch.  Addicting.  You won't be disappointed, save it to your list.
It is an interesting true crime show. I recommend it to those who like true crime television shows. I also particularly like the narrator's voice.
Fantastic as per usual!  Forensic Files is so well done and so fascinating!  There is not a bad episode to be seen!
The narrator is the best! I loved this season. Forensic files takes you right into the crime and gives accurate details about the crimes. The reinactments are not cheesy like the other shows !
Excellent! Love all these shows. So glad amazon offers them. Better than having cable. Don't have to pay for channels you don't want or ever watch.
I love Forensic Files. One of my favorite shows glad to see it on Prime.  Hope more will be added.
Keeps our attention from start to finish. Well put together.  Would recommend for anybody looking to fill 20mins of their day.

I am a pretty big fan of this kind of show and i tend to watch the shows that follow true crime. i always liked watching and reading Sherlock Holmes when i was a kid. Looking for subtle clues and piecing together an evidence puzzle is fascinating stuff to me. These shows follow that process. It is a reality show without a star (the studies, methods and processes are the stars -- along with the police and forensic scientists). Finding the truth to help others live and die with as much dignity as possible. Yes, I like these shows very much.

Even in the year 2017, cities still lack the seriousness of controlling "outsiders" such as those people who are bussed from larger cities posing as legitimate salespeople. This particular episode, "Death by a Salesman" was absolutely spectacular! The FBI working this case proved to be top notch individuals who were able to follow up on leads that could have been inconclusive. I can only say, I hope with all my heart that if I ever need a team of investigators to solve my case, that it will be this FBI team. I am in awe of such smart, clever, intuitive people! God bless these men and women who have been given that talent.
In general, this program,"Forensic Files" is one of the very best crime shows ever; it is my favorite. The events are so organized and well put together. I learn so much from these crime programs, such as why to NEVER, EVER leave your doors unlocked, no matter how much easier it is for a family member. These events tell us that there is no such thing as, "Oh, it will be okay. Who would have the nerve to enter?" Now we know, which is why I like these kinds of programs so much. On 19 June 2018, I splurged (very expensive) and persisted in having a great camera security-alarm system in place, in my home, even though I live in a very small, but still insecure city in AZ. I can go to my mailbox and if need be, I can press the red button and expect an immediate response from the local police. I feel very safe now. I pray every day that our first responders will be looked after, given the respect they deserve and saved from personal harm. They are truly heroic.

I enjoyed most of these episodes as I would have trained in law enforcement if I hadn't become an RN instead. To me these are similar professions for several reasons but I won't go into them here. BUT, I do not get the supposedly " trained" 911 operators! The callers are screaming for help or fright because they are being attacked and these operators are asking stupid questions like "what are they wearing or can you describe them?" I hope these operators are fired or at the very least get reprimanded and forced to get more training.
I love forensic files. I have purchased before.  I would give it 5 stars, except that you have to start after each episode.  The others that I have purchased play each episode right after the other.
Not my thing.
My wife and I enjoy watching Forensic Files together. Some murderers and the related people are the most frightening.
largely redundant of and less coherent than the far better produced "The FBI files"
This is a great show. Very educational. A must watch for current and future murderers.
Fast service everything is good
Great show for binge watching.
I love to watch Forensic Files < It is very interesting
